intro: Hydrobryum griffithii var. japonicum, commonly known as the Japanese water clover, is a rare aquatic plant native to Japan. It is characterized by its delicate, floating leaves that are deeply lobed and often arranged in a rosette formation. The plant thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and marshes. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, typically appearing in late summer. Hydrobryum griffithii var. japonicum plays a vital role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
